Default introduction.Message: Parents all over the world say they worry about keeping their children safe in the community and online.
Default introduction.Interaction message: Would you like some tips on some simple ways to do this?
Default introduction.Message for negative answer: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to how to keep your child safe in the community.

List of tips.Message: Thanks! One helpful way is to create a map with your child or teen that identifies the safe and unsafe places in the community. Here are 3 simple steps:

Option 1: Draw a map of the important pl.Message:
Step 1: What are important places in our community?

• Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
• Draw a map of your child or teen’s community, with pictures of all the main places like streets, your house, school, shops, places your teen visits...

 https://idems-media-recorder.web.app/storage/project/PLH/subproject/Rapidpro/deployment/Global/resourceGroup/image/universal/safety_planning_2.png

Option 2: Identify which places are safe.Message:
Step 2:  Which places are safe and unsafe? 

• Discuss which areas on your map are safe for teenagers – CIRCLE these.
• Discuss which areas on your map are unsafe for teenagers – CROSS those off. 
• What makes a place safe or unsafe? 
• Are there plans you could make together to keep your child or teen safer?
 https://idems-media-recorder.web.app/storage/project/PLH/subproject/Rapidpro/deployment/Global/resourceGroup/image/universal/safety_planning_3.png

Option 3: Learn about where you can get.Message:
Step 3: Where can you get support?

• Sometimes, we can find ourselves in trouble.
• Discuss together where you and your child or teen can get support or help when you face a crisis – MARK those areas with a little object like a stone or piece of paper. 
• Some helpful places may include home, school, police station, clinic.
 https://idems-media-recorder.web.app/storage/project/PLH/subproject/Rapidpro/deployment/Global/resourceGroup/image/universal/safety_planning_4.png

Option 4: Online map.Message:
Step 4: Online map

• Draw pictures of the apps and websites they use
• Praise your child for how good they are at using the web!
• Talk about which ones might be unsafe. Why?
• Are there plans you could make together to make using the internet safer for your child and their friends?
• It can really help for parents to learn about this in advance.
 https://idems-media-recorder.web.app/storage/project/PLH/subproject/Rapidpro/deployment/Global/resourceGroup/image/universal/safety_planning_5.png
